result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence D Strong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
*Restitution is set at ZERO.

*NO firearms; weapons.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved.
*Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

*-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: *Time is stayed pending a review on 11/13/15 at 1:30pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrence D Strong

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terrence D Strong in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Terrence D Strong in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Statements to the court by counsels and defendant.
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 14 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11-13-2015 at 1:30pm.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling .
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at ZERO.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terrence D Strong in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO AMENDED CHARGE:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Brach 38 on 8-6-2015 at 8:15 am.  EFFECTIVE AUGUST 3, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THE HON. JEFFREY WAGNER, BRANCH 38, IN ROOM 504 OF THE COURTHOUSE.   mld

Defendant Terrence D Strong in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the Charge to Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse), Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 947.01(1) and 968.075(1)(a) a Class B Misdemeanor."  mld

Defendant Terrence D Strong in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-3-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services "Court Reminders."  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Chuntay C

Defendant Terrence D Strong in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Defendant Terrence D Strong in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case called at 11:44 am.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue.   mld
from the State, received and filed.   mld

Defendant Terrence D Strong in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Parties are currently negotiating a deferred prosecution agreement.  Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 3-16-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Chuntay C

Defendant Terrence D Strong in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Terrence D Strong in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
